doc.after: Propagated from seed collected by William Baxter in southern Australia, common heath was introduced into cultivation in England by the Clapton Nursery in 1825.[43] Due to its frost-tenderness, it was mostly restricted to greenhouse cultivation.[10] In 1873, a variety known as Epacris impressa alba was recorded as being grown commercially for cut flowers in Boston in the United States.[44] While initially popular â over seventy cultivars appeared in the literature at the time â most have since disappeared.[45]
